name: Arena Stage at the Mead Center for American Theater

html_attributions: Arena Stage at the Mead Center for American Theater

reviews.text:
Had a fabulous date with my husband on a weekday evening seeing a heartwarming romantic comedy, "Holiday".  We had several good laughs and were completely invested in the drama. It's definitely a holiday escape, and It's a must-see!

The play was staged on The Fichandler Stage, an epic, four-sided auditorium, with steeply raked seating tiers with bold, earthy exterior design. Audience members are never more than eight rows away from the action. The cast came out from all corners of the stage and even from below! And what's a show without a trapeze? :)

During the intermission, I had one of their specialty drinks, Anita's Flowers, and my husband had The Mary Pickford, Jr. a non-alcoholic drink. They were both surprisingly very good. I highly recommend ordering any drinks or snacks in advance. "Holiday" has two intermissions but they are only 10 minutes each!

Absolutely beautiful and has magnificent architecture. Upstairs had an overlook where you can see the DC streets. So definitely arrive a little before your show to enjoy this experience as well.

Paid street parking, as well as garage parking, are available.

Loved my experience to see The High Ground at the Arena stage. Their parking garage was $27. This venue was larger than expected. There were multiple shows happening at the same time. I recommend getting here 35-40 mins before the show to enjoy the concession because no food/drink allowed. Masks are required for the duration of the show.

Had an amazing time as a cool friend date during the amazing American Prophet show. I'm the type that loves historical pieces that are about real people who made a difference. It's especially important for me to support productions showcasing true POC talent with amazing vocals the draws heart wrenching emotions. I especially loved the depiction of President Lincoln in a more critical light than we're used to.

Cornelius Smith Jr. was a star in his lead role as Fredrick Douglass (with two S's!) But my absolute favorite character was Anna Murray Douglass played by Kristolyn Lloyd. Really felt the genuineness of her performance and she shined throughout.

I will have to definitely come back to the Arena Stage for more performance and I sincerely hope you come back as well.

Pro tip: intermission is really quick so consider just bringing your own bottle of water to drink outside the theater during break.

What a great theater. Love the huge variety of shows they offer with fabulous casts!! Some are fun and some make you think about the world we live in, both past and present. The musicals are the best! ❤️🎭❤️

I am rating the location primarily based on the fact that I was informed MASKS are required inside the theater upon arrival at the theater.  I was unaware of this requirement before purchasing a ticket and did not notice anything related to these requirements on their website.  I find this incredibly ridiculous when masks are not required in the city nor on planes to enter the city.  I have no issue with those who choose to wear a mask, however I would like to have the same choice to not patronize locations that infringe upon my personal freedoms and dictate their own policies outside of city regulations.

Station 4 is a great place for Sunday Brunch with friends. My recent encounter was electrifying and refreshing. The food was really good, and the cocktails were good as well. There was a DJ playing music and accepting music requests from patrons. I was so anxious when I received my food, I almost forget to take a picture. However, I did capture a picture before finishing my meal. I would definitely recommend this location. My only suggestion is for you to call and make a reservation prior to arrival because the restaurant fills pretty fast and you may not have a chance to be seated if you don’t have one.

Went here for a Christmas Eve brunch and we loved it! The food great and drinks were good (strong😏)…. Maybe because it wasn’t busy lol. My favorite was the duck fries but overall their were tasty and good portion size. The metro (water front-green line) is right across the restaurant and parking garage is right around the corner.

ok had the Duck Fat Fries. They were crispy and good. Tried the watermelon steak salad... it's a winner SANS the ranch dressing( get vinaigrette). All the food was fresh and beautifully prepared.  Best stuff Salmon with crispy skin. Angel was my waiter and he was nice and patience. Nice ambience, for me easy parking. I'm coming back for happy hour.

Brunch was pretty good. The atmosphere is cool and some of the servers were on point, others not so much.  I had to send my steak and eggs back because I couldn't cut the steak, and I was using a steak knife.  I sent that order back (which I hate to do), and got the shrimp and grits instead. It was really good, tasty, and well seasoned. To go with our meal we had a bottle of Prosecco, an Irish coffee, and some tequila shots.
There was no music or any extra frills, but it was a decent brunch.

Good service and great food. I booked my reservation on OpenTable. The table was ready when we arrived. The servers was nice and attentive to our needs. The food came out quickly and it was hot! The bathroom was well stocked and clean. Parking was available on the street.

Boutique beer garden, nice space and quick service. Unexpectedly walked in on a rainy Friday and was pleasantly surprised. Definitely recommend it for having a beer in a more informal setting.

The place is very nice, with wide industrial interior design. It’s located in a walkable neighborhood surrounded by relatively new buildings.

Finally, it offers a wide variety of local beer, tasty American cuisine, many televisions to broadcast your favorite sports and you can order through your phone.

We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner just 2 of us on a Saturday at 4:30. We were lucky to have a table open upstairs and sat immediately.  They have QR codes at each table - you order and pay and tip all online.  Each QR is unique to each table and the servers bring out the food. We ordered the pastrami sandwich with fries and the shredded pork sub tots. The food came out quickly and hot.  The pastrami was great and so was the shredded pork. The tots were “weird “. I think they were fried squares of mashed potatoes.  The place was bustling and full. The bathrooms needed attention.

Stopped by before the Nationals game against the Atlanta Braves for some good beer. This place doesn’t disappoint… there is a wide variety of beautiful local craft beer. I had the DIPA Rainbow and it was awesome. Even though we didn’t get food … I wish we did because it looked so good. Friendly staff … but even better beer. I wish i could have taken a 4 pack into the game!!!!

I love this place. I will be back and back again. Drinks are good. House beers are very good. Strawberry Sky on a hot July day is a great cure for DC muggy heat.
Price is better than Georgetown.
Enjoy
(Look a Walgreens flag).

Food is delicious! We ate outside. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. We didn’t love the service, mainly because they use a QR code for the menu and you pay for your food in advance. Some people love that, but it felt like ordering carry out and getting it served to you at the table. Eventually, a server came and brought us hard copies of the menu and took our order. The ladies’ bathroom needed attention. I would go back again because the food was great and it could’ve been a tough night in terms of the restrooms.

No options for kids on the menu. We are big Moes fans and this place is below standards. Employees were not helpful I would even go as far as calling them rude. It's in a food court so please pass thos place by and try somewhere else. We ended up at the Potbellys next door they were very friendly.

The food was fantastic! I got a salad and they had fried tofu! The salsa is also so good.
—I really enjoyed the green salsa (seemed to almost have a pesto taste). A bit on the expensive side , but that’s to be expected for the area.

We(a group of five) stopped in after a long day of traveling and found ourselves very hungry. We split apart and tried many different orders within the food court but by far, Moe's Southwest Grill was the groups determined favorite. The staff was friendly, and the food was great.

This place is open later than most in the area. For that alone, 5 stars. Also, good food for a Moe's and definitely better than Chipotle. Very friendly staff (but I might not be the best to judge because I'm from NYC where everyone is always angry and mean - especially fast food workers).

Moe's is good fast Mexican food, but this location gives smaller than average portions and seems a little dirty.  You also don't get the traditional "Welcome to Moe's" when you get in line.  With a little improvement they could be much better.

A place to step away from the business of politicking... a few adult beverages and a nice meal and you will forget that you just walked two miles to see your representative or senator. Great food and atmosphere. I will definitely be visiting again to relax to the background music and tyranny talked about in the background. Good memories.

We were here for the capitol building tour and looking for some restaurants nearby to have lunch. This restaurant is only a 5mins walk. The food was delicious and waitress was nice. If you looking for something quick, I recommend here.

MAKE SURE YOU GET YOUR CARD BACK! Stopped in for beer and an app. Prices are crazy but they're high everywhere in the area. Service was alright, multiple people offered to take our order. Calamari came fast and was a decent amount for the price. Problem was our main server. We finished up and wanted to settle, he already had our card to charge and brought the booklet to sign. Time passed as we finished beers and hit the restroom. Hubby is good about double checking his cards before we leave places, he realized we were not given our credit card by the server. We waited a little longer, then hunted him down. He pulled out our card from his back pocket... if it were left at the card reader or something, that's one thing. To know we were done and leaving, if he "found" our card sitting at checkout he should have immediately brought it. Instead it was pocketed and the whole thing seems suspect.

Service was absolutely terrible. We waited almost 5 minutes to be seen and after the waiter took our food, we had to go find him after waiting 10+ minutes to get the bill.

The prices, I'll blame inflation on, but charging a party of 2 and automatic gratuity of 22% is nuts.

The food however was delicious.

Just walked 20 mins to get here.  There was an open table with 4 seats, I was by myself.  There were 3 people behind me waiting to be seated.  The lady refused to seat me because she said that there was 3 people she could seat instead.  Wow - and I had a group I was thinking of bringing here on Friday.

To the young woman host - be careful how you treat every customer as you just never know how important it could be.  A horrible experience from the start.  Bye!

name: Subway
vicinity: 1101 4th Street Southwest 4th Street Bldg, Unit 130, Washington

reviews.text: This is the best Subway I have been to in almost a decade and this includes international locations. They actually include ingredients in their sandwiches instead of just the meat and cheese.  And the family that runs the location are extremely friendly. Just love their vibe and sandwich artistry!

This subway was clean and they had all the meat and extras advertised. I wish they had more baked lays options instead of just regular. The service was good but there was a little wait to check out at the register.

Very Convenient spot on 4th street. First thing I noticed was that the restaurant is immaculate. Everything very clean and in order. Greeted with a hello. Best of all the sub was very good. I had a steak, egg and cheese on Italian herbs and cheese bread. No complaints here.
Thank you so much for filling our order for two sandwiches to go when we came in almost at closing time after tonight’s show at Arena Stage!
Great staff, clean, and awesome location so close to the metro.

Strange cafeteria style process.  Select dessert first, then soup or salad, then go to bar with check sheet to order entree.

Soup good. Entree a minimal sized appetizer that server brings to your table was hot and OK.. Dessert cake was not fresh/ hard and server replaced.
Overall food OK but not dinner size portions, and hi price for what you get. Then expected to bus own table.

So great to have a place we can grab a quick bite before a show if we're running late. The space is fabulous. Love the rock garden in the middle and how they sometimes decorate it to a theme. I had the chicken marsala which was good. Came with green beans and sweet potato, all good. It's not a fancy restaurant by any means but fulfills it's purpose beautifully.

Took the family to see Ann for my mom's 85th birthday.  Play was great, but Richard's place was a huge disappointment. Staff was incredibly rude to everyone in line; they gave incorrect information about simple ingredients like tomato regarding a food allergy; the hot entrees were served cold and tasted terrible.  As others noted the only decent food was the desert.

Ok. Seriously disappointed with Richard’s Place for their Brunch Prix-Fixe.  For the price, it is a rip off. I’ve seen elementary school cafeterias that had better food.  Choice and quality is ridiculous. They ought to just make it free to senior citizens as a benefit to attending a show, since they might’ve the only ones that found it to be any good.  On the flip side of the menu there were a la carte choices. Dramatic cuisine?  Please. Dream on. This is a lovely space but it’s wasted on service for cafeteria food.  The ultimate was you don’t even get coffee.  You have to pay for it.  I get the alcohol cash car. But yours a brunch that doesn’t serve coffee with your brunch. What sounded like a good idea to do before a matinee on a Sunday turns out to be a mood killing experience.  And one piece of sausage or bacon and eggs rationed out....I can’t even.

If I could give this zero stars I would.  You should advertise more realistically for this place.  Unless there are plans to do something better with this space, I’m not telling anyone to do it. Horrible!

I would give this place one star but I cant! The food was disgusting except for the cookies and baked mac and cheese and on top of that the crew had such an attitude for zero reason! Only one employ (black woman with half shaved head) had a good attitude and personality this one star is for her.

A Starbucks review really hinges on three things, the drink, the people, and the place.

This location gets 5 stars for my drink today. Fast delivery to the counter (I always order inside) and it was put together well - tight lid, hot beverage sleeve thingy, and no spills and stuff on the outside of the cup (hate that). I ordered my drink extra hot and I got what I asked for.

The team was working really well together and the short line showed that. Fine job. Extra points for a really friendly staff here.

The place is Starbucks upgraded- not just the standard furniture and fixtures and they have nice outside seating here.  Nice place.  Parking near here is going to be a challenge though.  Restroom was clean and in good order.

Very well done here today SBX. thanks.

What a cool Starbucks! Obviously, amazing location at the wharf but on top of that it has unique seating and a cool vibe. There’s a stage (for live music, I presume?) and lots of comfortable seating indoors and tons of outdoor seating as well. Will definitely be back to this one!

I would describe this Starbucks as slow, inefficient, and having a lack of customer service. People were waiting for 10-15 for regular and ice coffees. They were sitting drinks down without calling out names and 3 employees were just talking behind the counter while I was standing there waiting to order. The reasons for 2 stars is when we finally got our order they tasted good.

Great Starbucks !!
Location is very convenient. It's welcoming, batista are friendly and drinks are perfect.
I loved the atmosphere. It was comfortable and modern.

I've been going to this store for about 3 weeks now. There are some great associates working here but unfortunately there are some others that aren't great at all. For instance I went there on Sunday evening and the cashier was super slow. So I said something about it to my friend who was with me at that time. However, that was not really the issue, the issue is that this cashier tried to be funny and wrote my name wrong on purpose even the barista noticed that and called him out on that one. He grinned and said yes I know I did it on purpose... I don't think that was funny at all so I asked him what was my name to which he replied with my correct name. I do like this store and I tip every time because I feel for them. I tip for their hospitality. There are two cashiers that are awesome! (Two Ladies in morning time, I don't remember their names, though if you've been there before then you know who I'm talking about). I don't mean for this guy to get fired or anything but I strongly believe that he should be disciplined to align his behavior according to Starbucks standards or be moved to a different station where his behavior doesn't affect the guest experience. (The cashier spoke Spanish) but we kept the conversation in English, of course.

Very nice Store with friendly staff and a great menü. We are from Germany and stayed in the region for work and went there every day for coffee and breakfast. Beside the american breakfast they have a lot of healthy add ons and possibilities. Also the quality of the food was very good. its a compfy nice athmoshere and we always felt very Welcome. The Time we stayed there it was our favourite breakfast place ~

Routinely, the Atrium Cafe is a great place and I have visited it often as I work in the area. I primarily visit it for breakfast related items. Unfortunately, today I ran into something I felt needs to be at least mentioned in a review. I have seen, and at times have had, fresh baked items from this location - but this morning the cinnamon roll was clearly old when I went to have it a short bit ago. Displaying and selling old bakery items as fresh is so below the level of service I expect from here, it became noteworthy in a negative way. I would not say avoid this cafe based on this, but be wary and perhaps check (or ask!) the bakery items before you leave the location. They usually do better, and I have come to expect quality bakery items, FRESH ones.
I love this place. Sandwiches are the best around. Get there before noon though...it fills up quickly (because the sandwiches are so good!)
A great small sandwich shop in SW. Open at 6:30 for breakfast and a great choice for lunch quick sandwiches. You might find a line but it moves pretty quick.

I like their meat portions on our meal. They are generally generous with it. The location is great from my workplace. The guy at the registrar is generally cool and friendly. There's long line sometimes during the peak lunch hours but that's normal for any place. The employees sometimes could be difficult to understand due to the language barrier but overall a great Cafe for brunch and lunch.

Always busy at lunch, but they get everyone through the line quickly. Generally friendly service with tasty subs and salads. Helps if you know what you want because sometimes when it’s busy they’ll start taking orders several customers deep into the line.
Decent sandwiches, soups, and lunch type foods. Conveniently located right by Federal Center SW Metro station, very close to Congressional and other buildings downtown. Service was ok.

Horrible experience! Poor customer service! First and LAST time at this restaurant at this location.  Not if other places treat customers poorly like this place. People seemed that don’t care about working there. No “good vibes” as they have printed on their sack lunch.  No substitutions were made to provide a full meal. Menu items were missing with the order. No apologies or any substitutions were offered.

My English it’s not the best of the world. But if you talk with an angry person that could be a problem. It’s my first time in potbelly and assh*** person treat us like shi** just cuz he does not like his job …… :@
Sandwhich artists are top of the line 👌🏼 it’s nice to see friendly crew members who know how to work well together and have fun.

Roti recently made a poorly thought-out, poorly-executed change to online orders. It used to be that all sauces were served on the side with online orders. This makes sense, because it keeps the meal from being soggy, and allows customers to choose how much of each sauce they would like to use.

Without any notice to customers, Roti unilaterally decided that all sauces will now go directly in the bowl. The online ordering system offers no option for on the side, or control over how much sauce you want. Customer service tells me this was to reduce waste. They also said I should put "sauces on the side" in the pickup notes.

Well, I've tried that, and it didn't work. TWICE. The second time was after I complained to customer service about the first time not working. I don't blame this location -- pickup notes are not meant to be notes to the kitchen. I doubt Roti corporate trained their kitchen staff to look for notes -- they just decided everyone will get sauces directly in the bowl and like it, no consumer choice.

I also tried waiting in the torturously slow line to have my meal made in-house, but they shot the sauces in the bowl so freaking fast that I still got too much. I could not tell them to stop soon enough. It seems that Roti is determined to over-dress their meals.

I will not remove this one-star review until sauces on the side with online orders are restored. If you want to give customers the eco-friendly choice, do what Sweetgreen did and BUILD THAT IN TO ONLINE ORDERING. Sweetgreen took their time to test the process of offering mixed salads, and notified customers of the change. And my choices are always respected, because they did it right. Roti did not do it right. Corporate should be ashamed.
This was the worst Mediterranean food ever! The chicken was dry, sweet potatoes weren’t good and they small portions. No pride was taken by the staff.

Unfortunately the quality has gone down, probably due to cost cutting. Their sides used to be very good like the broccoli and carrot. Now, it’s just shredded carrot. Chicken used to be better also.

I’ll still come here however, just not with the same gusto.

I had roti Mediterranean food today. This is one of my favorite to eat. I love their different sauces like red sung, green sung, hummus, garlic and tahini. This is one the good lunch for vegetarian lover. This one also comes with rice and pitas bread that makes dish complete. If someone like pickle then this restaurant has lots option in that.

I like to visit this frequently.

Delicious, fresh and healthy Mediterranean foods! I walked 17 minutes to eat this. Michael was friendly and conscientious. He gave me this beautiful tasty bowl of chicken roti. I wish they open a branch in Washington State

The establishment was indeed in full swing when I arrived however I placed my order ahead of time, and spent 45mins waiting for a drink. When my friend asked about the drinks the barista Eddie became extremely snappy and told us that we could just get a refund because He didn’t really care. I am a frequent patron of Starbucks and I have never received service like this. In my opinion, Eddie needs to undergo sensitivity training.

I put in a mobile order, when I went to pick it up it was not ready, had to wait more than 20 minutes. Asked a barista about my order and he made it but it wasn’t the right order. A jade citrus mint tea tasted like a regular green tea that I could’ve made by myself. No citrus flavour added, no honey or sugar. It was disgusting. Am very disappointed

How is a coffee shop constantly out of oatmilk? Why is this a constant problem?? If every single weekend you are out of oatmilk, maybe you should update your inventory? Maybe when you see you have only 2 cartons left, you order more??? What is management doing!!?
The gentleman who was passing out mobile orders during the very busy breakfast rush today was a ray of sunshine! Very impressive to be so friendly during a very stressful stretch of time.

This is single-handedly the worst Starbucks I have ever been to. They routinely lose track of the orders, mess up the drinks, take 30 minutes to serve a drink, forget items, etc. There is zero leadership here and I genuinely do not know how they are still in business. It is appalling.
Drink was good, but can you please put some effort into keeping the place clean.  Counter was dirty, trash on the floor, and the bump and grind playlist was annoying.

Smoke everywhere, you can barely breathe, eyes burning. And when you asked them to leave the door open or open a window they just plain out rude ignored you and said No were not going to open a door! People went outside waiting for their drinks! I mean we all work and get busy, don’t be rude to your customers!

Lovely customer service, fast efficient, but they seem to miss an ingredient or two when making my coffee, especially my vanilla blonde latte was not sweet at all like they missed the vanilla syrup or something. Other than that they’re great! 🤍

Always an issue with orders here. I'm now out $8 for a mobile order with an item out of stock, which I requested a refund to my original payment method for. Of course, the cashier did not know what she was doing, refunded it to a gift card, and told me it would refund to my credit card. Now, have to dispute the charge with my credit card.
The staff is mediocre, I didn't feel welcomed but they weren't rude either. The place is very neat and clean. I ordered the ice coconut milk mocha macchiato, it was good and made in a Timely manner.

Great food and great service as I’ve come to expect from most Nando’s. The place was practically empty at around 2 pm on a nice Sunday. There is indoor and outdoor seating.

The space was very neat and well kept. Condiment/utensil/fountain drink area was very neat and organized. Food was ordered via scanning a QR code and through the app/website. You pay (and tip) through the app/site as well. The servers brought our food over in about 10-15 minutes. Food (wings, fries, rice and skewers) were all very good.

Overall a good experience, my only issue/recommendation was more bathrooms. They currently have two (2) gender neutral bathrooms. When I was about ready to leave, I had to wait about 10-15 minutes for a bathroom to become available (both were seemingly occupied by employees). This was when the restaurant was empty….I can’t imagine how long that wait would be if the restaurant was busier.

The area is nice with a lot of eating options. Parking can be tough, but there is a reasonably-priced outdoor lot at Water Street and 4th Street. ($2-$3 per hour)

3.5 Pretty good food. We ordered the chicken burger which was flavored well, the peri peri chicken bowl (loved the rice but it lacked flavor), 1/4 chicken breast which was good & the boneless chicken which was well cooked and spicy. Staff was okay, but we loved the ambience. Really quick service too, we were surprised at how fast the food came!

Good was amazing , unfortunately ate it all before I took some pictures. Staff is friendly, manager Giovanni was amazing !! Came and made sure everything was okay.  Great service and food.  This location at Navy yard is great !!

Such a great meal! I got the chicken thighs hot with brussels sprouts and red mashed potatoes. And the ultimate blessing of this meal was the garlic bread, the best combination of moist, crispy, buttery, and warm. You have to get the garlic bread!

When you get there you order from your phone so if you have questions about the menu you will have to get up to ask. Also I had terrible reception so someone had to order for me lol but it was an excellent dining experience.

You can eat outdoors or indoors as well. There isn’t much free parking around but there is a parking lot that is a short walk which is $1 hour. So very affordable.
The naughty natas are to dead for so delicious. I just couldn’t get one. The chicken is always cook on the grill. Peri-Peri sauce is so good.
Very delicious and it has a lot of different choices for excellent subs. The food sources are fresh and great!
This location is my fav Subway because staff are so pleasant; just giving out good vibes.  Thank you so much.  Food is delicious, and location is clean.

I've been here several times and the service is always poor. On many occasions I've entered to find all the staff in the back and have had to wait several minutes for someone to even come out. They also seem understaffed and only help one customer at a time, so you better hope that the person in front of you isnt ordering a lot. And don't bother trying to go after 5. They start getting into shutdown mode for when they close at 8. I've been there at 7 and the man behind the counter told me they were out of bread.

It's okay in a pinch, just don't expect much.

This Subway is on School street between 4th and L'Enfant  metro station. The place is really small, just 4-5 tables to sit. The food is OK although if you want better choices L'Enfant is 5 min away. Also at lunch time the waiting could be 15 min. Overall it's one of better choices for carry out in the area.
Service slow and not real friendly. BUT the price was right. Food was average for a Subway.

THE place for inexpensive authentic as-can-be Thai food popular within the GenZ government interns who frequent this long-standing joint that survived the pandemic with good old fashioned delicious food.

We love this place and it’s food and come here enough to know a good thing when we eat it. The drinks come heavy, the apps come fast, and the entrees never disappoint. Come here for the early crowd and Happy Hour specials. We had the spring rolls, fried wontons, yellow and red curries where you can adjust spiciness. Careful not to get ahead of yourself, looks can be deceiving.
Came for a late Friday lunch with my teenage son during a sightseeing visit. Excellent, fresh Thai food. Friendly, attentive service. I'm definitely coming back when in DC again.
Incredible food, great service and super fast. The Papaya Salad was so fresh and the basil stir fry was super flavorful. Also loved the drunken noodles, they weren’t overly oily or greasy.
Decent Thai food.  Flavors are partially there.  Home run on Pad Thai. Coconut milk dishes could use additional lemon grass flavoring

I got the Pad Peanut Sauce where you can pick your own meat and chicken was recommended. It. Was. Amazing. I pride myself on making a pretty good peanut sauce for tofu my family all loves but this is definitely better. I wish I was a good enough cook to figure out what they did different but I will have to be content knowing I can come back and have the dish again anytime.

name: Starbucks
vicinity: The Portals, 1201 Maryland Avenue Southwest, Washington

reviews.text: Conveniently located near the capitol mall. The store was a little bit messy when we arrived in the morning with some trash on the floor. Bathrooms were pretty clean. The baristas were friendly and were very quick with the orders!

Sometime only small moves makes a huge difference. Visiting from Toronto stopped by to get our coffee after a good 4 hours walk/ride. Chance  the gentleman in the picture offered free cake pops to my kids as a welcome to Washington. He is truly a customer service ambassador and I wish him all the very best ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

This outlet is brilliant.
It helps us jet lagged travellers have a shot of coffee before the day starts.
The staff are very friendly, helpful and welcoming.
Will probably visit every morning during my stay.
Cheers guys.

I love a peach green lemonade.
I ordered here and it wasn't what i always ordered. I was in shocked. It was boiled water with 2 bags of the green tea and peach tranquility (missing the lemonade).
I do not recommend this location.
Great staff! Super patient (it took us a good 5 min to order!). Then they even brought our drinks and pastries to our table! Great service!

I waited 10 minutes for them to warm my loaf and only got it because I asked for it. And when I let one of the employees know I was waiting that long, she gave me a dirty look as if I was bothering her. She had the absolute worst attitude. I spent a total of 20 minutes in that Starbucks. not to mention the music is ridiculously loud, the employees are unprofessional, they're singing at the top of their lungs and talking to each other so much that they don't pay attention to their customers. It's like they were having a party instead of doing work.

Worst experience and service at a starbucks yet. Had 7 employees behind the counter and 4 of them were just standing around! Waited on my coffee for 15 minutes just for it to be wrong! Then it took another 15 minutes for them to fix it! I could see if they were busy but they were not. AVOID THIS LOCATION AT ALL COST!

Awful. Worse Starbucks I ever visited. Waited for order more than 20 minutes and had almost empty cup instead of cappuccino. And associate start to convince me its supposed to be like that. Like if there is foam on 80% and only one table spoon sized shot of espresso under it. Like it was my first cappuccino!

The attitude of one female staff member is not friendly. When I asked for a straw, she scolded me to wait and then left the straw with her back to me without looking at me. She wasn't even that busy. It was very unpleasant.
Nice for a quick bite and coffee in the morning. Service was very friendly! The dining area is small, so this Starbucks seems more like a take-away place.

This outlet was across from our hotel.
The Skinny Pizza Melt was delicious.
Staff were friendly and helpful.
We were the only patrons during our visit though a couple of take aways were ordered and collected
Cost of the breakfast was considerably cheaper than the one in our hotel.
Definitely worth a visit.
Thanks

The customer service here is HORRIBLE. The “manager” sitting on the counter, screaming from the the back “WE ARE CLOSED”  when they still have 5 mins for taking orders. Sign is still outside and the doors weren’t locked..so rude and unprofessional..I can’t with this young generation and their non manners..🙄

So sad, it happened a couple of times to me! I used their mobile app to place the order. When I got there, standing for 20 minutes around “Mobile pick up” area, no one came to help. What even worse, they hadn’t make the food, so totally 40 minutes after I placed the order, they gave it to me without any words. Like you deserve to wait for that much time. I have been coming to this stores for years, but would never use their mobile order.

Terrible service, not great food, bland soup, and we really love most  PotBellys!  Coffee shake was a “special”, was poorly made. First time we ever had a “warm” watery milkshake. When I took it to the counter to tell them something was wrong,  I was told essentially that it was my fault “You mean it’s not thick enough” and “the machine makes it that way”, I was never offered a redo, just a blank stare. Unbelievably poor attitude and customer service.
It is not good! Did not enjoy it at all. The soft drink machine doesn’t work and no ice. However, the cashier let me get a bottle drink from the refrigerator. It does not look clean.

name: Mitsitam Native Foods Cafe
vicinity: Independence Ave SW & 4th Street Southwest, Washington

reviews.text: Surprisingly, food at museum's cafeteria can be good. Everything was very well seasoned and delicious. The rib has a sweet taste from the sauce that they brush on top. The salad the comes with it is very good. The goat stew has somewhat a strong goat smell but it is fine for me, and the meat is really soft. Dipping the fry bread in the stew is really tasty. Dessert is the only thing that is disappointing.

We really enjoyed the three sisters salad, wheat berry salad, and enchilada! The wheat berries were chewy and well-cooked, with a  light dressing with the mushrooms, and the beans had a great marinade and balance of textures and flavors.
The jicama salad was alright but I’m pretty sure it gave me mild food poisoning - hard to tell for sure though. I really appreciated the different options, especially the healthy options, and the staff. It was overpriced and the lack of free water made me a little mad (and $4 for a teabag) but I get that’s how they make money. It’s a cool concept for a cafe!

The lunch here was mediocre at best. First, there was not a very big selection. I ordered a cheeseburger and steak fries. The steak fries were very good. The burger was dried out, burnt, and on a roll that was way to big for it. They only had canned soda, both fountain soda machines had an “out of order” sign on it.

We also got the fry bread which I thought was good.

Cafeteria style restaurant inside the museum (they had several food trucks parked outside the museum too). The fry bread for my Indian taco was the best I've ever had: it was perfectly crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, and not too greasy. The cafe is expensive, though: $50 for my daughter and I to have lunch with no dessert and only water to drink. Since the museum is free, though, it seems like a good way to support it.

A surprisingly good Museum cafe option. The Indian taco on fry bread was very good, and so was the bison burger and fries. There were good options for small kids as well. The cafe got crowded at lunch time, but the cafeteria style service moved quickly. Definitely recommend this museum and cafe!
